result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status Conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Due to scheduling conflict with the La Crosse County Jail, Status Conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 1:30 has been rescheduled to November 10, 2022 at 9 AM. Parties do not object.
Status Conference on October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense moves to cancel the Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 and set for a Status Conference. State does not object. Status Conference set for October 20, 2022 at 1:30 PM.

9:07 AM- Same appearances- Defense advised defendant unable to post cash in each case as set. Defense refers back to first motion. Defense requests to lower cash bond. State objects to bond modification, makes argument. Court amends bond in 22CF34 and 22CF36. Case no. 22CF35 bond to be amended.
